<div  style="max-width: 55rem; float:left;">
Registration is **free**<!-- and will be open until `r REGISTRATION_ENDS`-->. To be considered for a presentation, you must register and submit an abstract by `r SUBMISSION_ENDS`. 
Abstracts may be uploaded during the registration process, and should follow the formatting guidelines described below.  All 
abstracts will be reviewed by the [organizers](https://medicine.yale.edu/lab/kleinstein/people/). Acceptance is based on 
scientific content and relevance to the meeting goal, which is to showcase 
the use of a variety of the Immcantation tools in advacing
knowledge of adaptive immune responses. Abtracts should state explicity how Immcantation was used in the research.

Selected speakers will be contacted
by email by `r CONTACT_SPEAKERS`. The final program and selected abstracts will be published on `r FINAL_SCHEDULE`.

The registration form is available [here`r fontawesome::fa(name = "fas fa-link", fill = "bg-primary")`](`r REGISTRATION_FORM`).

### Abstract formatting guidelines

An abstract template is available for download <a href="static/AbstractTemplate.docx">here`r fontawesome::fa(name = "fas fa-file", fill = "bg-primary")`</a>.

* One abstract per presenting author.

* 250 words maximum.

* Title in bold text.

* Title cannot be in all capital letters.

* Presenting author must be underlined.

* Use the asterisk symbol (*) to signify the Corresponding Author(s).

* No comments, text or image boxes in the abstract.
    
* .rtf, .docx, .pdf  documents only.
</div>
